intro: Draba atuelica, commonly known as the Atuel bentgrass, is a small flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its compact stature and dense foliage make it a hardy species often found in alpine or semi-arid regions. Draba atuelica produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and soil stabilization.
